title: Cosmic Revolutionary

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and brown ink, on cream wove paper, laid down on cream wood-pulp laminate card.

medium_display: Pen and brown ink, on cream wove paper, laid down on cream wood-pulp laminate card
inscriptions: Signed lower right: "Klee"; inscribed lower left: "1918/ 181"
credit_line: Mr. and Mrs. Sigmund Kunstadter Memorial
publication_history:
Jürgen Glaesemer, Paul Klee: Handzeichnung, I (Bern, 1973), p. 255.

Christian Geelhaar, "Klee-Zeichnungen," Reise ins Land der besseres Erkenntnis (Cologne, 1975), p. 18 (ill.).

Christian Geelhaar, Klee-Zeichnung, no. 45 (ill.).

Tilman Osterwold, Paul Klee: Die Ordnung der Dinge (Stuttgart, 1975), no. 139 (ill.).

Otto Werckmeister, From Revolution to Exile (New York, 1987), p. 45 (ill.).

Otto Werckmeister, The Making of Paul Klee’s Career 1914-1920 (Chicago, 1989), p. 156 (ill.).

Dirk Teuber, Intuition und Genie: Aspekte des Transzendenten bei Paul Klee (Mannheim, 1990), p. 41 (ill.).

Wolfgang Kersten and Osamu Okuda, Paul Klee: Im Zeichen der Teilung (Dusseldorf, 1995), p. 335 (ill.).

Paul Klee Foundation, Paul Klee: Catalogue Raisonné, 2 (Bern, 2000), p. 518, no. 2028 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galerie Tarica, "Paul Klee," November 22-December 22, 1963.

London, Brook Street Gallery, "Klee," June-September 1966, cat. 5.

New York, Saidenberg Gallery, "Paul Klee Drawings," February 1-March 25, 1967, cat. 7.

Munich, Leihschein Galerie im Lenbachhaus, "Paul Klee Retrospective," December 12, 1979-March 2, 1980, cat. 359.
provenance_text: Private collector, Bern; sold to Klipstein and Kornfeld, 1962 [a letter from Christine Stauffer of Galerie Kornfeld of January 8, 2004 in curatorial file]; sold, Klipstein and Kornfeld, Berne, May 24, 1962, lot 125; Berggruen and Company, Paris, 1962-about 1967 [Paul Klee Foundation 2000]; Saidenberg Gallery, New York, 1967 [New York 1967].  Harry Lynde Bradley, about 1968 [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  John Kings, Sheridan, Wy. [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  Bodley Gallery, New York [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  Joan and Lester Avnet, New York [Paul Klee Foundation 2000].  Sold, Sotheby’s, March 18, 1976, lot 46b.  John and Paul Herring and Company, Inc., New York, 1976 [Paul Klee Foundation 2000]; sold to the Art Institute, 1978.
